intro: Myriocephalus scalpellus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silvery-gray leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. Myriocephalus scalpellus is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
